intro: Microula polygonoides, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its fibrous roots help it retain moisture in harsh, dry conditions. Microula polygonoides is adapted to extreme temperatures and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
